channel.title: Just My Show
channel.description:
Where else can you find the dad from "Silver Spoons," the lead singer of Wang Chung and the creator of "MadLibs"...all in one place? Welcome to Just My Show, the retro pop culture podcast. Our job is to bring you back to all those things you forgot you loved growing up.
Just My Show brings you interviews with some of your all time favorite people from classic TV, movies, sports and a whole lot more. (We love jogging your memory by throwing in some more obscure stuff too!)
So take a quick break from that boring day job or add some familiar old friends to that morning commute. Wherever you are, just sit back and enjoy.
This isn't rocket science...it's Just My Show.
channel.itunes:author: Just My Show
channel.itunes:summary:
Where else can you find the dad from "Silver Spoons," the lead singer of Wang Chung and the creator of "MadLibs"...all in one place? Welcome to Just My Show, the retro pop culture podcast. Our job is to bring you back to all those things you forgot you loved growing up.
Just My Show brings you interviews with some of your all time favorite people from classic TV, movies, sports and a whole lot more. (We love jogging your memory by throwing in some more obscure stuff too!)
So take a quick break from that boring day job or add some familiar old friends to that morning commute. Wherever you are, just sit back and enjoy.
This isn't rocket science...it's Just My Show.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Retro Pop Culture Podcast

item.title: #70 CHiPs Star Larry Wilcox
item.description: CHiPs star Larry Wilcox is here to celebrate the classic cop show's 35th anniversary. Get the real story behind his relationship with Erik Estrada, surviving motorcycle stunts and his short stint as a disco singer. With a special appearance by Seven Mary Three's Casey Daniel and much more in the latest edition of New News About Old Stuff.
item.itunes:author: Just My Show
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: #69 TV & Radio's Shadoe Stevens
item.description: Shadoe Stevens joins JMS to talk about The New Hollywood Squares, American Top 40 and his current gig as the announcer for The Late Late Show. Plus, remembering broadcasting legend Dick Clark with American Bandstand dancer Bunny Gibson, Bloopers producer Bryan Michael Stoller and $100,000 Pyramid winner Andy Culpepper.

item.title: #68 The Goonies' Joe Pantoliano
item.description: Joey Pants is on the podcast to talk about his classic roles in The Goonies, Risky Business, The Sopranos and many more. Plus, remembering Davy Jones and much more in the latest edition of New News About Old Stuff.

item.title: #67 The Cosby Show's Geoffrey Owens
item.description: The Cosby Show's Geoffrey Owens is here to help Just My Show kick off its seventh season! Hear everything you ever wanted to know about Elvin and one of the greatest sitcoms of all time. Plus, remembering Robert Hegyes, John Parr revisits St. Elmo, and more in the latest edition of New News About Old Stuff.

item.title: #66 Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer Singer Dr. Elmo
item.description: Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer singer Dr. Elmo joins us on our annual holiday podcast to talk all about his unlikely Christmas classic. Plus, The Karate Kid's Randee Heller and much more in the latest edition of New News About Old Stuff.
item.itunes:author: Just My Show

item.title: #65 Just Born Candy Co-CEO Ross Born
item.description: Just My Show talks retro candy with Ross Born, Co-CEO of Just Born, the makers of Mike & Ike, Hot Tomales and Peeps. Legend has it that Just Born is also the inventor of Jimmies (or is it sprinkles?)! Plus, Bill Buckner, Where's the Beef?, and Fonzie's motorcycle on the auction block in the latest edition of New News About Old Stuff. Happy Halloween!
item.itunes:author: Just My Show

item.title: #64 Double Dare Host Marc Summers
item.description: It's the game show you grew up watching. Double Dare host Marc Summers is on the podcast to take you behind the scenes of television's all time slimiest show as we close in on its 25th anniversary. Plus, A Christmas Story's Zack Ward and much more in the latest edition of New News About Old Stuff.

item.title: #63 The Smurfs' Danny Goldman
item.description: Before you catch the new Smurfs movie, show a little respect for the original! Just My Show chats with Danny Goldman, the voice of Brainy Smurf in the classic Saturday morning cartoon. Plus, Cheap Trick's close call, another Vacation, and Nick's salute to the 90s in the latest edition of New News About Old Stuff.

item.title: #60 JMS at Big Apple Comic Con
item.description: Just My Show spends an exciting day at Big Apple Comic Con! Special guests include: The Brady Bunch boys, Willy Wonka's Paris Themmen (Mike TV), Seinfeld's Larry Thomas (The Soup Nazi), WWF legends Greg "The Hammer" Valentine & "The Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase, Wizard Entertainment CEO Gareb Shamus and much more.

item.title: #54 The Miracle on Ice's Dave Silk
item.description: 30 years later, do you still believe in miracles? Yes! JMS gets you in the mood for the upcoming Winter Olympics by celebrating the 30th anniversary of the Miracle on Ice with the 1980 U.S Olympic Hockey Team's Dave Silk.

item.title: #52 Pinewood Derby Pioneer Donn Murphy
item.description: It's the Cub Scout event that many a kid grew up with. More than 50 years after its very first race, Just My Show chats with the inspiration for the Pinewood Derby (and son of its creator), Donn Murphy.

item.title: #51 The Brady Bunch's Susan Olsen
item.description: It's been called one of the worst TV shows of all time. Cindy Brady herself, Susan Olsen, is here to talk about "The Brady Bunch Variety Hour," the subject of her new book "Love to Love You Bradys." Plus, tennis writer/broadcaster Bud Collins with a special commentary on Andre Agassi's controversial new book.

item.title: #50 Singer/Songwriter Billy Vera
item.description: It shot up the charts after being featured on a few classic episodes of "Family Ties." Now, singer/songwriter Billy Vera is here to talk about the #1 hit "At This Moment" and much more. Come celebrate 30 years of Billy Vera & The Beaters!

item.title: #49 Remembering Michael Jackson
item.description: Just My Show remembers The King of Pop by taking you behind the scenes of his breakthrough "Billie Jean" video with director Steve Barron. Plus, reaction to the passing of Farrah Fawcett and Ed McMahon.

item.title: #47 Wang Chung's Jack Hues
item.description: You know his voice from hits like "Dance Hall Days," "Let's Go" and, of course, "Everybody Have Fun Tonight." Just My Show chats it up with Wang Chung lead singer Jack Hues. Catch Wang Chung in the U.S. this summer as part of the Regeneration Tour!

item.title: #43 The Hogan Family's Jeremy Licht
item.description: It went through three names, two leading ladies, and two networks. Yet The Hogan Family managed to last six years and is well remembered as one of the great family sitcoms of the 80s. Listen to on and off camera insight as JMS hangs out with Mark Hogan himself, Jeremy Licht.

item.title: #35 Sit, Ubu, Sit: A Chat with Gary David Goldberg
item.description: In Just My Show's first bonus podcast of 2008, we sat down with Emmy winning TV producer Gary David Goldberg to talk about his seven years as creator/executive producer of "Family Ties." Goldberg is the author of the new autobiography "Sit, Ubu, Sit: How I went From Brooklyn to Hollywood with the Same Woman, the Same Dog, and a Lot Less Hair."
item.itunes:author: Just My Show
item.itunes:summary:
In Just My Show's first bonus podcast of 2008, we sat down with Emmy winning TV producer Gary David Goldberg to talk about his seven years as creator/executive producer of "Family Ties."
Goldberg is the author of the new autobiography "Sit, Ubu, Sit: How I went From Brooklyn to Hollywood with the Same Woman, the Same Dog, and a Lot Less Hair."

item.media:text:
In Just My Show's first bonus podcast of 2008, we sat down with Emmy winning TV producer Gary David Goldberg to talk about his seven years as creator/executive producer of "Family Ties."

item.title: #23 Tom Wopat & Alan Spencer
item.description: He may be a big man on Broadway these days, but "The Dukes of Hazzard" is on the agenda as the one and only Tom Wopat drops in. Then...Alan Spencer, creator of the cult TV hit "Sledge Hammer," joins us for an extended talk about his show and his one of a kind experiences in the industry.

item.title: #22 1991 NBA Slam Dunk Champ Dee Brown
item.description: Remember when you really cared about the slam dunk contest? Just My Show gets you ready for all-star weekend by taking you back to one of the most memorable dunks in NBA history. We caught up with 1991 slam dunk champ Dee Brown to get the story behind his legendary no look jam and his thoughts on this year's contest.

item.title: #21 Ted Lange & Samm Levine
item.description: Just My Show kicks off its second year with an hour long episode featuring two super sized interviews. First, we hit the road for the very first time to visit the one and only Ted Lange for the inside word on "The Love Boat" and the latest season of "Celebrity Fit Club." Then, it's the best show you may have never seen. We go inside the short lived cult hit "Freaks and Geeks" with actor Samm Levine.

item.title: #17 WKRP's Gary Sandy & Cheers' Paul Willson
item.description: Just My Show caught up with Gary Sandy to talk about his four seasons as program director Andy Travis on "WKRP." Then, he may be third wheel to Norm and Cliff, but we couldn't be happier to give Paul Willson the VIP treatment. Plus, the story behind the "WKRP" closing theme.

item.title: #9 90210's Matthew Laurance & Brutus Beefcake
item.description: Matthew Laurance talks about playing Dr. Mel Silver on "Beverly Hills 90210" and relives those "Wild Summer Nights" when "Eddie And The Cruisers" ruled the Jersey Shore. Then, wrestling legend Brutus "The Barber" Beefcake drops by to talk about the old days in the WWF.
item.itunes:author: Just My Show
item.itunes:summary: Matthew Laurance talks about playing Dr. Mel Silver on "Beverly Hills 90210" and relives those "Wild Summer Nights" when "Eddie And The Cruisers" ruled the Jersey Shore. Then, wrestling legend Brutus "The Barber" Beefcake drops by to talk about the old days in the WWF.
item.media:title: #9 90210's Matthew Laurance & Brutus Beefcake
item.media:text: Matthew Laurance talks about playing Dr. Mel Silver on "Beverly Hills 90210" and relives those "Wild Summer Nights" when "Eddie And The Cruisers" ruled the Jersey Shore. Then, wrestling legend Brutus "The Barber" Beefcake drops by to talk about the old days in the WWF.
item.author: comments@justmyshow.com (Just My Show)

item.title: #8 Chris Burke & Joel Higgins
item.description: To celebrate the release of "Life Goes On" on DVD, "Just My Show" caught up with Corky himself, Chris Burke. Plus, A look back at "Silver Spoons" with Joel Higgins (Edward Stratton III).
item.itunes:author: Just My Show
item.itunes:summary: To celebrate the release of "Life Goes On" on DVD, "Just My Show" caught up with Corky himself, Chris Burke. Plus, A look back at "Silver Spoons" with Joel Higgins (Edward Stratton III).
item.media:title: #8 Chris Burke & Joel Higgins
item.media:text: To celebrate the release of "Life Goes On" on DVD, "Just My Show" caught up with Corky himself, Chris Burke. Plus, A look back at "Silver Spoons" with Joel Higgins (Edward Stratton III).
item.author: comments@justmyshow.com (Just My Show)

item.title: #7 ABC News' John Quinones
item.description: Somehow, your friendly host found himself on ABC's "Primetime" as part of a hidden camera taxi experiment on racism. Now that I've been on his show, "Primetime" co-anchor John Quinones returns the favor by dropping in to discuss my crazy cab ride, his career, and even a little pop culture.
item.itunes:author: Just My Show

Now that I've been on his show, "Primetime" co-anchor John Quinones returns the favor by dropping in to discuss my crazy cab ride, his career, and even a little pop culture.

item.title: #6 Tim Van Patten & Hurricane Peter McNeeley
item.description: Before he was a big time TV director, he was Salami on "The White Shadow." We go back to Carver High with Timothy Van Patten. Plus, he was the first man to face Mike Tyson after his long awaited return to boxing...we check in with Hurricane Peter McNeeley.
item.itunes:author: Just My Show

item.title: #5 Dennis Haskins & Terence Winter
item.description: Two big guests from pop culture TV! First, America's favorite principal, Dennis Haskins, on his years on "Saved By The Bell." Then...Terence Winter, writer/executive producer of "The Sopranos" stops by to talk about the show and the start of its big final season.

item.author: comments@justmyshow.com (Just My Show)

item.title: #4 One Shining Moment's David Barrett
item.description: March Madness has arrived! To get in the mood for The Big Dance, Just My Show spent some time with David Barrett, the writer and original voice of "One Shining Moment." Hear what David had to say about sports, this year's tournament and his most famous song as we lead up to it's 20th playing on CBS.
item.itunes:author: Just My Show

item.title: #3 Kenny Kramer & BNL's Kevin Hearn
item.description: We're back for our big second show! Guests: Kenny Kramer (The Real Kramer), Kevin Hearn (Barenaked Ladies), John Wilson (Razzie Awards Founder) and Tyson Mao (Rubik's Cube competitor/"Beauty & The Geek")

item.title: #2 Buddy Holly's Peggy Sue
item.description: On February 3, 1959, Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens and The Big Bopper died in a plane crash on what has become know as The Day The Music Died. Forty-seven years later, Peggy Sue Gerron (Yes, THAT Peggy Sue), looks back on Buddy Holly and her famous song.
